intro: Oligactis cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' oligactis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
